markdownRemark.excerpt: Death is the waiting-room where we robe ourselves for immortality.  C harles Spurgeon , p. 180. 09/24/2009 Updates: See the  ”  This is It  ”  Michael Jackson…
markdownRemark.html:
Death is the waiting-room where we robe ourselves for immortality. Charles Spurgeon, p. 180.

When I read from someone I follow on Twitter that Michael Jackson was dead. I thought it was a hoax, the source was a practical joker of sorts and you do hear a lot of this on the net. I remember a while back, rumors spread that Robert Pattinson (the guy who plays Edward Cullen for the Twilight movie) died of some freak accident, that turned out to be a hoax. But when a lot of tweeps are sending their condolences, the truth felt like icy cold water over my head. Controversies aside, Michael Jackson is – was a great man.   His music touched more hearts than anyone before him, and still does. You can have a billion R&B singers and gaZillion rock stars out there but you can only have one King of Pop  More than his music, we will miss the man behind it. He truly won his immortality in this world and the next.   >

09/24/2009
Updates: See the ” This is It ” Michael Jackson movie trailer here.
